definition: to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary
lump (of earth)/chunk/piece/classifier for pieces of cloth, cake, soap etc/(coll.) classifier for money and currency units
erhua variant of 碎塊|碎块[sui4 kuai4]

sentences.english: Several wolves were rending a lamb to pieces.
sentences.chinese: 幾條狼正在把一隻羊撕扯成碎塊。

sentences.english: Vegetables should be cut into small pieces and dropped into the boiling water.
sentences.chinese: 蔬菜應切成小碎塊放進開水裏。

sentences.english: Some pieces do not fit for further working, so they don’t reach the end of the conveyor.
sentences.chinese: 不適合進一步加工的碎塊便不再傳送下去。

sentences.english: Some of the grid sections will accumulate immediately in the trowel areas.
sentences.chinese: 有些板柵碎塊可能立即堆積在刮刀的地方。

sentences.english: Freezing weather will break up the soil into small pieces.
sentences.chinese: 嚴寒天氣會使土壤凍成小碎塊。

sentences.english: The massive sulfide contains fragments of barren and mineralized gabbro, and schist.
sentences.chinese: 中含有礦化的和未礦化的輝長岩及片岩碎塊。

sentences.english: These fragments disintegrated in huge explosions in the upper atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 這些碎塊在木星大氣上層的巨大爆炸中炸得粉碎。

sentences.english: Pieces of glacier that break off become mixed with thin sea ice in a jumble of ice fragments on the fjord's surface.
sentences.chinese: 脫落的冰川碎塊與峽灣表面混亂的碎海冰融合在一起。
